title: For Sale:  BUFFALO-BARNES LEAD-FREE HEAVY 357 Mag - 140 gr. Barnes XPB @ 1550 fps - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
https://www.extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=290

For those wanting/needing a lead-free, HEAVY 357 Magnum load, generating full power plus, here it is.

Below are real world velocities taken from my personal stock guns. The industry established use of long laboratory test barrels that give false high velocity readings is essentially misleading to the public who won’t be firing the ammo from a laboratory test barrel in the real world, where it matters.

1947 fps—Marlin mod 1894, 18 inch barrel
1518 fps—S&W mod 27, 5 inch barrel
1519 fps—S&W MT Gun, 4 inch barrel
1436 fps—S&W mod 66, 3 inch barrel
1385 fps—S&W mod 66, 2.5 inch barrel
You’ll notice the newer S&W 4 inch Mt. Gun, gave higher velocities than the older 5 inch mod 27 S&W. This is because of different internal barrel dynamics and chamber dimensions of the newer gun. In general, the newer S&W revolvers are made to tighter tolerances than those of 30+ years ago.

Due to the long-for-weight all copper bullet, the 357 does not have the case capacity to use a bulky flash retarded powder and thus there is a noticeable muzzle flash with this load in all the test revolvers, however the rifle shows no flash at all due to its longer barrel.

This load is the typical barn-burning, turbo charged, Buffalo Bore type HEAVY 357 Mag. load and as such, should only be used in revolvers made of all steel. It should not be fired in light weight, alloy framed or cylindered revolvers. Feel free to use it in ANY/ALL 357 mag. chambered rifles and all steel revolvers/handguns.

title: For Sale:  Lightly Used LMT Defender 2000 SOPMOD, upgraded
postcontent:
This unit was produced in 2013 at Lewis Machine & Tool. I have the QC hand checked card that shipped with it as well as the original box, manual, and plastic sleeve. This isn't a "cleaning out the safe" bullshit ad. Just a rifle that you might have been looking for. Charging handle is the standard Gen 2 tactical LMT handle. I've got the basic LMT Gen 2 CAR stock if you want it as well. Barrel is 16", 1:7, Chrome 

Upgrades - I won't tell you what they cost because you have Google too.
Troy MRF-CX 12" free float rail system w/ ladder rail covers
Rock River National Match 2-stage trigger - supposed to be 4.5-5 lbs. Feels lighter and VERY crisp
Troy Ambidextrous QD end plate
Defense Industries Ambidextrous Selector/Safety - Can be set for Right or Left dominant
MagPul B.A.D. Lever
Original LMT SOPMOD stock with storage and QD connection
Yankee Hill Manf. Phantom Flash hider

BCG and chamber have been head-spaced and fired by LMT (per the hand check card). The original trigger was very gritty (like many Mil-Spec) so I swapped it for this RRA NM one. The old trigger is gone, but you'll be so pleased with this one, you won't care. The rail mounts over the original gas block and front post sight on a new barrel nut. Very nice if you ever want to remove it for gas tube cleaning or exchanging.

The Ergo grip is OEM and branded with LMT on the side and bottom. In fact, you'll find LMT marks on the upper, lower, grip, removable rear sight, and SOPMOD stock. It is truly set up as a mil-spec weapon - and you can ask your buddies who went over. Plenty of units are equipped with LMT rifles.

I will include a brand new 5.11 Tactical 36" rifle case (as shown) for full asking price. If you want to haggle, no problem. I'll be happy to entertain offers if you don't mind my counter-offer. I believe this to be a fair price for an excellent rifle. Approx. 200-300 rounds down the pipe (that might even be high). This groups better than "mil-spec" getting between 1.25" and 2" groups at 100 yards, outdoors, with M193 ammo and a 4x32 ACOG. I have only shot it without a rest from a typical range sitting set up. Add a bipod or sandbag and better ammo -who knows.

postcontent:
We have for sale a Springfield Armory XDM.

The gun comes with Trijicon Night Sights already installed.

It's chambered in 9mm and has a 19+1 CAPACITY!

The gun is used but in excellent shape and comes with the factory box, papers, dual mag holster, backstraps, loader, and 2-19rd magazines.

Here is some more info on the gun-
The XD(M)® pistol from Springfield Armory® sets the standard for what a polymer pistol can be. The XD(M)® has everything you want and need in a pistol – superior ergonomics, reliable performance, and features that make it easy and intuitive to use. The XD(M)® 3.8” Full-Size is the perfect pistol for those who want full-size performance in a slightly shorter package.

The XD(M)® 3.8″ Full-Size mates a 3.8″ barrel with a full-sized frame. This means you’ll get the handling and capacity you’d expect from a standard sized pistol, but with a shorter top end for easier carry. The XD(M)® is packed with features. The three interchangeable backstraps mean that no matter what size your hand, the pistol can fit it perfectly. postcontent:
Elcan M145 3.4x28 fixed magnification scope w/ M-249/M-240 machine gun illuminated reticle, 2 extra batteries, laser filter, honeycomb kill flash (ARD), lens covers, and padded case.  Field manual dated 2001.  Very good condition, no scratches on glass. 

I've always loved the M145, and consider it far superior to the ACOG (except the big 6x48), having similar magnification but with slightly better glass and a far superior field of view. I do love Trijicon as a company, but this thing is just awesome.  It is a little bit heavy compared to the ACOG, but to me the trade-off in increased FOV is very worth it.

reason for selling: trying to raise money for an upgrade to the Specter DR -- if I can scrape it up from other sources, I'll probably pull this off the market and just keep it.

title: For Sale:  AK Pistol! CIA Centurion C39 milled ak pistol in 7.62x39
postcontent:
Advertised here is a CIA, 100% American made ak pistol chambered in 7.62x39. It's a milled receiver made from a solid block of steel. Solid piece. Panic ready, doomsday ready, whatever your flavor. 
**** want cash or ZASTAVA M92 AK PISTOL***, possibly the zastava m85 ak pistol in 223/556
***** might entertain an offer for an AR
*** if you're bored and something cool gun wise to offer let me know. No lowballs. Worst I can say is no. 
*** must do face to face. No shipping. I will meet you halfway. Make an offer 
Upgrades to gun:

-Has Krebs custom enhanced safety lever with "bolt hold open" feature so you can operate safety with the shooting hand still on the pistol grip 
- Hogue OD green pistol grip with built in/removable storage compartment inside grip
- Magpul AFG angled foregrip in OD green with adjustable/ removable finger grooves
- lightweight, polymer quad rail/ picatinny/ weaver rail, so you can easily mount your favorite optics, lasers, flashlight etc...
- integrated sling swivels
- shark fin front sight vs the typical front post style sight
- elevation/ wind age adjustable read leaf site with adjustable set screw
- solid, 1 piece construction, MILLED! Not stamped receiver! Made right here in the good old U. S. of A. 
- Tapco G2 DOUBLE hook fire control group/ trigger which I particularly like. Super crisp light trigger pull with positive reset. Pleasure and easy to pull 
- AK recoil buffer installed onto the BCG/ spring which drasticallyyyyyyyyyy reduces recoil and muzzle climb. Seriously google it if you want. This little 14$ upgrade might arguably be the best single upgrade purchased for this piece. Wayyyy less recoil. This and the AFG and you're good. 
- Tapco custom retaining plate instead of cheap AK shepherds crook 
-Tapco birdcage flash hider (AR style) built for this piece. Really spreads the pattern of the fireball that comes out the muzzle in a cool X pattern like the ARs do. 
- CHROME LINED BARREL, shoot all the cheap commie steel ammo you want, this puppy can eat it for breakfast lunch and dinner. 
- a 3 point sling included 
- nice floating gun bag with 4 mag pouches and storage zipper made by Bulldog 

This gun has been pampered and cleaned thoroughly after every outing. Probably around 700 rounds down the pipe I have upgraded everything for reliability and performance and long lasting use. This was my primary SHTF piece and got it just the way it should be to make it through that scenario. I love the ak platform and have 2 Serbian/ Yugo ak variants and want to get rid of this one and buy another different ak so I can have all yugo/ Serb aks. I'm Serbian and love our line of ak variants and want them all now! This is a great piece and quality made with quality made upgrades. EVERY single time I go to the range with this piece I get crowds of people asking about it and wondering what it is. It looks like robo cops gun. People love it. I love it. And have let those spectators shoot my gun to their surprise and let everyone enjoy it. This is a piece to enjoy and share with others. So that's what I did and plan to do by selling it or trading so I can get my next project. A zastava pap m92 ak pistol. Which is cheaper than the one I have. But I want one. I will also entertain the zastava pap m85 ak pistol chambered in 223/556
Guns should be fun, and you should enjoy shooting them, and they should also protect your home and family. This piece fits the bill, great for home scenarios with its short body and barrel. Easily maneuverable in tight places. And it's classified as a pistol, not a rifle. It's a pistol in rifle caliber. Must have FOID card to purchase. No FOID, don't contact me. I might entertain an offer for an AR just because I kinda want one. Text me for updated pictures. These are kind of old and don't depict all external upgrades. Will happily text you back. That the easiest form of contact. I will definitely message you back. Just say your name and tell me you're contracting me about the armslist post. title: For Sale:  Armasight Spark CORE ceramic gen 1+ NOD w/ rail mount
postcontent:
Armasight CORE ceramic high definition Gen 1+ NOD w/ throw-lever picatinny rail mount.  Like new condition.  Original cost for all parts was about $680.

This is the lowest grade NVG that in my opinion is worth fooling with.  Gen 1 NODs just don't do a whole lot, and I can see almost as well with my naked eyes as through the unit.  IR illumination makes this thing an asset, however.  If you're considering a sub-Gen 3+ unit, you're going to need an illuminator or it's a waste of time and money.  I have found the Eagletac t20c w/ 3.4w IR module to be fairly effective, although it has a wider beam than is optimal.  Using it in conjunction w/ this Armasight CORE, I can ID a coyote vs. a sheep at about 180 meters.  Viewing through an Eotech reduces that to about 150 meters.  The rail mount puts it a bit too low for my Aimpoint -- the misalignment drops ID range to about 120 meters.  

The illumination is at or maybe a hair above standard for a gen1+ device, and only functional to just past twilight without IR illumination.  The integral illuminator is a wide flood that actually works quite well for indoors, but has a maximum effective range of about 10 meters.  This unit's claim to fame is the use of ceramic (like the gen 3 units) instead of plain glass in the interior, getting the resolution up noticeably from conventional gen 1 units, as well as increasing durability by a fair margin.  They advertise a ~53 lpi resolution, and that seems about right.  not the 67~72 of a good Gen 3, but on par with most Gen 2 units.

I probably recommend this as the best bang for your buck under a good Gen 3+ PVS-14.

title: For Sale:  Used Ruger SR9C Bi-Tone
postcontent:
The SR9c compact pistol weighs in at 23.40 oz. and features an overall length of 6.85", a height of 4.61", and the same slim 1.27" grip width (across safety levers) as the full-sized SR9. It comes with two magazines that provide options in both capacity and grip size. The standard magazine holds 10 rounds and features a flat bottom butt plate; a finger grip extension floor plate is also included. The second magazine features a grip adapter and holds 17 rounds, instantly transforming the smaller, compact grip into a full-sized 9mm grip (Not included for CO, NY, CA, NJ, HA sales). The 3.50" barreled pistol features an integral accessory rail that accommodates most lights and lasers.

The SR9c compact pistol utilizes the same adjustable, high-visibility 3-Dot sight system as its full-sized predecessor, setting it apart from many compact pistols that rely on fixed sights. New serrations are located on the front portion of the slide, making it easier to both manipulate the slide and to press check the chamber. 

Just like the original, full-sized SR9, the SR9c is loaded with modern safety features like a 1911-style ambidextrous manual safety, internal trigger bar interlock and striker blocker, trigger safety, magazine disconnect, plus a visual and tactile loaded chamber indicator.
Includes only 2-10 rd magazines.

title: For Sale/Trade:  STIHL MS 271 Chainsaw BRAND NEW
postcontent:
Up for sale is a BRAND NEW Stihl MS271. Still has the first tank of gas in it from the dealer. I purchased saw for a project for a client and literally cut 2 branches off a tree. I really have no need for this saw and would hate to see it just sit in my shop for years. I am asking a VERY FAIR price of $550 cash with everything you see.
 Specs Below-
 pecifications:

Displacement: 50.2 cc (3.06 cu. in.)
Engine Power: 2.6 kW (3.49 bhp)
Powerhead Weight: 12.3 lbs.
Guide Bar Lengths (Recommended ranges): 16"-20" (18" standard)
Fuel Capacity: 500 cc (16.9 oz.)
Chain Oil Capacity: 240 cc (8.12 oz.)
OILOMATIC® Chain: 26 RM3
Key Features:

Reduced-Emission Engine Technology - Caring for Nature: The STIHL® Inc. “Caring for Nature” (see image above) seal identifies its powered products that are more environmentally conscious, producing zero or low exhaust emissions. STIHL® Inc. defines “low exhaust emissions” as being cleaner than EPA and/or CARB exhaust emission standards.
STIHL® Quickstop® Chain Brake System: Equipped with a chain stopping system designed to reduce the risk of injury in certain kickback situations. Designed to stop the rotation of the chain if activated by the operator’s hand or by inertia if the saw kicks back with sufficient force. In some working positions, it can be activated by inertia, stopping the chain within fractions of a second.
Anti-Vibration System: STIHL® has developed a system for minimizing the vibration levels of handheld outdoor power equipment. This system helps reduce operator fatigue and provides a more comfortable working experience.
IntelliCarb™ Compensating Carburetor: Designed to automatically adjust the air/fuel ratio when the air filter becomes restricted or partially clogged and maintains the engine’s correct RPM. It uses air from the clean side of the air filter to control the diaphragm and flow of fuel. As the air filter becomes dirty and less air is available for the carburetor, this system adjusts the fuel flow to compensate for the decrease in air flow. This is in contrast to typical carburetors that utilize this air from the “dirty” side of the air box.
Winter/Summer Shutter: Allows the carburetor to operate at optimum temperature year-round and helps to prevent carburetor icing when working below 50°F (10°C).
Ematic™ Lubrication System: When used with STIHL® OILOMATIC® saw chain will provide proper lubrication and less oil consumption than conventional methods. The system works because two ramps, strategically placed in the guide bar rail, help contain the flow of oil and direct all lubrication to the sliding faces of the bar and chain links as well as the rivets and driver holes, which in turn can reduce bar oil consumption up to 50%.
Side-Access Chain Tensioner: Makes it more convenient for the user to adjust the saw chain with a bar wrench as opposed to the typical location of the guide bar adjustment screw.
Master Control Lever™: Easy to use single lever, operating the choke, starting throttle lock and on-off switch. The operator must pull the throttle trigger before moving the Master Control Lever™ to the choke position.
STIHL® OILOMATIC® Saw Chain is made by STIHL®.
Additonal Features:

Bumper Spikes help prevent pull-in and provide better control, making cutting easier
Spark Arrester Muffler has large baffles which reduce noise level and contain a screen designed to reduce the emission of sparks
Front Hand Guard is designed to reduce the risk of injury
Front Handle is designed for a secure grip and ergonomically angled for comfort
Protected Spark Plug is protected, yet easy to change
Large Starting Handle is easy to grip
Smooth Clean Design has no rough edges to snag on clothing or brush
Air Filter Cover is easy to remove for fast and easy filter cleaning or replacement
Rear Hand Guard reduces the risk of injury as well as provides a wide area for foot placement during starting
High-Tech Polymer Housings are lightweight, withstand greater impact and are corrosion-resistant
Translucent Fuel Tank allows operator to easily check fuel level before starting work
Electronic Ignition provides easier starting and smoother running
Replaceable "In Tank" Fuel and Oil Filters lower cost and are easy to maintain
Automatic Bar and Chain Oiler lets operator concentrate on cutting, not on bar lubrication
Chain Catcher helps reduce the risk of operator contact by a chain if it should break or derail
Throttle Trigger Lockout must be depressed before the trigger can be activated

title: For Sale:  West German Sig Sauer P228 (KE-1994)
location: Muncie (Ft. Wayne, Indy), Fort Wayne, Indiana
postcontent:
I have for sale an exquisite sample of an ORIGINAL West German P228 (Original finish, has NOT been re-coated)....This is not the same gun that Sig is pedaling as an M11-A1. This is the real deal. I am the second owner of this firearm, however both owners have babied this gun. There is MINIMAL wear on the slide, frame, rails, and barrel. I carried the gun once (for fun), however there is no evidence to suggest routine carry. It appears we both used it as a safe queen. 

I do not know the actual round count, and I would guess I sailed ~300 rounds down range. It is a (KE) triple serial marked P228 indicating it was made in 1994. I have the original cardboard box (one corner is torn at the spine), manual, warning tag, and what I believe are the original 13 round mags. I do not have the test target (I will double check but I'm pretty sure it was never included). Gun is equipped with standard "dot the i" sights.

Magazines feed reliable, gun fires flawlessly, and has the precision accuracy you would expect from a West German Sig. I have had ZERO issues with this masterpiece. I hate to sell it because of it's fame, quality, and condition, however I do not shoot it near as much as it should be and I am currently funding other projects. I will not entertain any trades so please do not offer anything other than cash. 

I have done my best to provide detailed pictures, however feel free to message me for more pictures, information etc. I will do my best to answer any and all questions to the best of my knowledge. 

I will ship at buyers expense, however I would like to keep it a local transaction. I require a DL, Carry Permit, and a Bill of Sales. If you cannot meet that require (with the exception of the carry permit) DO NOT INQUIRY. 

My price is fair considering the condition and rarity of the firearm, however I may have a little wiggle room. DO NOT low ball me, you will be rejected/ignored. Reasonable offers will be considered.

title: For Sale:  Katadyn Water Filter
postcontent:
I have a brand new Katadyn pocket water filter that I am looking to sell with all original packaging and parts. Primarily this filter is meant for camping and other outdoors activities but serves well as an emergency backup filter if you find yourself without a clean source of water. Here's the product description from the internets:

Built for long-lasting continuous use, the Katadyn Pocket water microfilter features a silver-impregnated ceramic element that's effective against bacteria and protozoa even in extreme conditions. Unlike disposable filters, the ceramic element can be cleaned several times--even in the field. More importantly, the element filters all microorganisms larger than 0.2 microns (0.0002mm), producing clear, drinkable water wherever you are. The pump also includes an improved, round pump handle for better ergonomics and an outlet hose that attaches to water containers with a single clip.

The Pocket hails from Katadyn's Endurance series, a high-quality line of filters that can produce up to 100 times more water than standard water filters. The Pocket is so tough in fact, that it's the first choice for extreme adventurers like Mike Horn. Plus, it's the only water filter with a 20-year warranty. Other features include a measuring gauge that indicates when you should change the filtering element, a cushioned base that makes it easy to pump on all surfaces, a prefilter, and a carrying bag.

Specifications:
Capacity: 13,000 gallons / 50,000 liters
Dimensions: 24 by 6 centimeters / 10 by 2.4 inches
Output: 1 quart/liter per minute
Technology: 0.2 micron ceramic depth filter (cleanable)
Weight: 550 grams / 20 ounces
20 year warranty
What's in the Box?
Prefilter, bottle clip, and carry bag
Product Description
